name: Mixed Bag 36 Multiple Choice Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Tough [D] | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of these four magazines is the oldest?
questions.explanation:
Reader's Digest.

	Reader's Digest started in 1922. Esquire 1933, Fortune 1930 and Playboy 1953.

questions.text: How many degrees in an isosceles triangle?
In which country did William Tell reportedly live?
questions.explanation:
Switzerland.

	He was a Swiss patroit. His killing of Gessler is regarded as the beginning of the struggle for liberty which ended up as Switzerland.

questions.text: What is the instrument used in geometry to measure angles?
questions.explanation:
Protractor.

	It is used for the laying of and measuring of angles.

questions.text: What is the frame used to support space rockets prior to lift off called?
questions.explanation:
Gantry.

	It is defined as the frame of a traveling crane or the crane and frame together.,

questions.text: An overstuffed footstool is called an ottoman?
questions.explanation:
True.

	It is defined as an upholstered backless and armless seat or sofa or an upholstered footrest.

questions.text: Which of these is Florida's official flower?
questions.explanation:
Orange blossom.

	On the other hand, the coreopsis is Florida's official wildflower. The rose is the state flower of Georgia, Iowa, New York and North Dakota. The orchid and tulip are not state flowers.

questions.text: What was the name of the yacht owned by J.P. Morgan?
questions.explanation:
Corsair.

	He was an American financier, art collector and philanthropist.

questions.text: Which of the following measures more than the others in length (all regarding U.S. currency)?
options: 2 fifty cent pieces side by side
questions.explanation:
4 pennies side by side.

	Try it if you can find 2 half dollars.

questions.text: If a dying relative left you a barcarolle what would you do with it?
questions.explanation:
Sing it.

	It is a boatman's song.
